main event: Witnesses observed a slow-moving bright circular object in the night sky over Tulsa, Oklahoma on June 21, 1967.
interesting points: The object was approximately 30 feet in diameter and bright,It was seen moving slowly before abruptly stopping for about 5 minutes,The object then accelerated at a tremendous speed and vanished from sight in seconds,When it left, it gave off a flash of light illuminating the entire sky for a radius of at least 5 miles,The sighting lasted for about 3 hours.
witness description: the observation was made by two friends
